title: [K-12] Screencast Design for Academic Library Education: Multimedia Learning Theory-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and experience in library resource retrieval
context.additional_context: Library System Education for Pre-Service/In-Service Teachers to Utilize Social Studies Research and Educational Materials

learning_goals: Learners can efficiently explain major academic library database search methods through screencasts
Learners can design educational screencasts by applying multimedia learning theory (five core principles)
Learners can implement a process for improving screencast content based on participant feedback
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
